{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

changeRepositionOverride.theText: Stay within 2 spaces of a hero adjacent to a terminal.

globalEvents.name: Open Crate 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

entityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
Rebel engineers are concluding their analysis of the schematics. Hoping to keep their discoveries secret, Command has sent you to keep an eye on their progress and hand-deliver their results.

Much to your surprise, you arrive to a facility in shambles and overrun by Imperial forces. Worse, your approaching transport is fired upon and brought into a rough landing.

Fleeing through the forest with a battalion pursuing close behind, you come across a listening post for the facility. You recall that this area has a network of tunnels connecting the facility with emergency escape routes.

You should be able to access the escape tunnels through the listening post if you can manage to find their entrance before the Imperial forces catch up.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} The mission will progress when a Rebel figure enters the Corridor (click on the green highlight and select "Enter Corridor").
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win early
globalEvents.eventText:
You manage to pry the blast doors open just enough for everyone to squeeze through, right before one final explosion sends heavy stones thundering down. Dust and fragments of rock flood into the tunnel, but you're already on the move.

It might still take some careful maneuvering to duck the Imperials when you return to the surface, but far now, you're home free.

It's a bitter victory with the loss of the outpost. The schematics are gone, along with whatever detailed analysis the Rebel engineers could have provided. At least you made it out early.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Place Story Mission card "Chain of Command" into play.
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Because the blast door was opened before the end of Round 5, heroes receive an additional 100 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
With one final blast, the building rumbles around you, heavy stone fragments raining down from above. Your only choices become staying inside as the structure collapses around you, fighting your way out, or surrendering.

Charging outside, you're ready to put up the fight of your lives until you see just how many Imperial troops stand waiting outside. Several dozen blasters are pointed in your direction, and surrender becomes your only option.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Place Story Mission card "The Source" into play. Play "Captured" as a forced mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win late
globalEvents.eventText:
You manage to pry the blast doors open just enough for everyone to squeeze through, right before one final explosion sends heavy stones thundering down. Dust and fragments of rock flood into the tunnel, but you're already on the move.

It might still take some careful maneuvering to duck the Imperials when you return to the surface, but far now, you're home free.

It's a bitter victory with the loss of the outpost. The schematics are gone, along with whatever detailed analysis the Rebel engineers could have provided.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Place Story Mission card "Chain of Command" into play.
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Because the blast door was opened after the end of Round 5, increase the threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.

globalEvents.name: Too Late Trigger
globalEvents.eventText:
Explosions keep rocking the building, and you hear more and more Imperial troops converging on the listening post. 

You have missed the chance to get out early, but you can still escape.

globalEvents.name: Wrong Terminal 1
globalEvents.eventText: After searching for what feels like ages, you have to admit to yourself that you won't find anything here.

entityProperties.name: Wrong Terminal 1
entityProperties.theText:
The ceiling has collapsed here, burying a computer console under rubble.

{-} A hero can interact with the terminal to test ({I} or {J}). If an Imperial figure is within 2 spaces of that hero, apply -1 {B} to the results.
{-} If the hero passes, he finds out if the terminal contains useful data.

globalEvents.name: Wrong Terminal 2
globalEvents.eventText: After searching for what feels like ages, you have to admit to yourself that you won't find anything here.

entityProperties.name: Wrong Terminal 2
entityProperties.theText:
The ceiling has collapsed here, burying a computer console under rubble.

{-} A hero can interact with the terminal to test ({I} or {J}). If an Imperial figure is within 2 spaces of that hero, apply -1 {B} to the results.
{-} If the hero passes, he finds out if the terminal contains useful data.

globalEvents.name: Schematics
globalEvents.eventText:
Shoving aside rubble, you finally locate a terminal with information you can use. The building shudders against another heavy impact as you frantically scour the files for any details on the underground tunnels.

You find schematics for the tunnels themselves and map out a quick route, but some of the schematics have been damaged. The portion that could show you how to get in to the tunnels from this listening post is a mess of garbled lines and text. You'll have to find another copy of the schematics.

globalEvents.name: <color="red">Hidden</color> Passage
globalEvents.eventText:
Dust and stone fragments shower from the ceiling; the structure is now under constant attack.

You consider trying your luck against the mass of Imperial forces outside just as you find the controls to open the underground tunnels.

Pressing a series of commands, you expect the hidden blast door to grind open. Instead, you hear the loud whine of metal under strain followed by a highpitched screech. Red warnings display across the terminal screen.

Jammed. Of course.

{-} The neutral mission token represents the blast door. A hero can interact with the blast door ({K}) to try and pry it open.
{-} The Rebels win when they open the blast door.

entityProperties.name: Blast Door
entityProperties.theText:
The Blast Door is jammed tight. It will take some force to open it enough for you to slip through.

{-} A hero can interact with the blast door ({K}) to try and pry it open.

{-} A hero can interact with the terminal to test ({I} or {J}). If an Imperial figure is within 2 spaces of that hero, apply -1 {B} to the results.

entityProperties.name: Wrong Terminal 2
entityProperties.theText:
The ceiling has collapsed here, burying a computer console under rubble.

{-} A hero can interact with the terminal to test ({I} or {J}). If an Imperial figure is within 2 spaces of that hero, apply -1 {B} to the results.
{-} If the hero passes, he finds out if the terminal contains useful data.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Imperial mission tokens represent rubble. Rubble is difficult terrain.
{-} At the end of each round, and during certain events, the Empire will fire artillery shots at the structure.
{-} The neutral mission token represents the blast door. A hero can interact with the blast door ({K}) to try and pry it open.
{-} The Rebels win when they open the blast door.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

You start cleaning the rubble and pushing buttons to try and find data about the tunnels.

{-} Test {I} or {J}. If an Imperial figure is within 2 spaces of that hero, apply -1 {B} to the results. Apply +1 {B} to the results for each strain token on the terminal, then discard all strain tokens on the terminal. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
You make some progress, but you still haven't found anything of interest.

{-} Place 1 strain token on the terminal for each {B} gained.

globalEvents.name: Enter Corridor
globalEvents.eventText:
Feeble lights flicker on as you enter the corridor. At the same time, explosions rock the building. In the back of the facility, you see a gap in the wall, blasted by Imperial soldiers to gain entry.

Somewhere in here must be information about the tunnels.

{-} Imperial mission tokens represent rubble. Rubble is difficult terrain.
{-} At the end of each round, and during certain events, the Empire will fire artillery shots at the structure.
{-} A hero can interact with a terminal to test ({I} or {J}). If an Imperial figure is within 2 spaces of that hero, apply -1 {B} to the results.
{-} If the hero passes, he finds out if the terminal contains useful data.
{-} The mission will progress when data about the escape route has been found.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

entityProperties.name: Corridor Entrance
entityProperties.theText:
The listening post lies in ominous silence, only sparely illuminated by emergency lights.

{-} The first time a Rebel figure moves beyond this space, click "Enter Corridor".

eventActions.theText:
{-} Imperial mission tokens represent rubble. Rubble is difficult terrain.
{-} At the end of each round, and during certain events, the Empire will fire artillery shots at the structure.
{-} A hero can interact with a terminal to test ({I} or {J}). If an Imperial figure is within 2 spaces of that hero, apply -1 {B} to the results.
{-} If the hero passes, he finds out if the terminal contains useful data.
{-} The mission will progress when data about the escape route has been found.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Pursuit
globalEvents.eventText: The gap in the wall on the far side of the facility is finally big enough to let enemies through. Immediately, soldiers pour in. "Weiss wants that scum alive!", an officer shouts, pointing at you.

globalEvents.name: Bombardment-1
globalEvents.eventText:
Artillery fire rains down on the facility. Explosions ring out, turning stone into rubble. The ceiling collapses on {rebel} and everything in the vicinity.

{-} Place an Imperial mission token on the space of {rebel}.
{-} {rebel} and all Rebel figures within 3 spaces of {rebel} suffer 2 {H}.

globalEvents.name: Bombardment-2
globalEvents.eventText:
Artillery fire rains down on the facility. Suddenly, a huge blast echoes through the building. {rebel} is caught in the shockwave and sent sprawling.

{-} Place an Imperial mission token on the space of {rebel}.
{-} {rebel} and all Rebel figures within 3 spaces become <color="red">Stunned</color>.

globalEvents.name: Bombardment 3
globalEvents.eventText:
Artillery fire rains down on the facility. An explosion right next to {rebel} tears open the wall, sending showers of razor-sharp stone shards flying.

{-} Place an Imperial mission token on the space of {rebel}.
{-} {rebel} and all Rebel figures within 3 spaces suffer 1 {H} and become <color="red">Bleeding</color>.

eventActions.theText:
You force your fingers in the gap and pull with all your might.

{-} Test {K}. Apply +1 {B} to the results for each strain token on the Blast Door, then discard all strain tokens on the Blast Door. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
You pull as hard as you can, inching the door open little by little. It is still not wide enough to slip through, however. You need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token on the Blast Door for each {B} gained.
